intro: Acronia ankyloglossa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acronia, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Acronia ankyloglossa is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep root systems that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
